sentences.en: ...the gloom of a foggy November morning.
sentences.cn: …一个雾蒙蒙的11月早晨的昏暗。

sentences.en: "I wish I did," said Phil Jordan, relapsing into his usual gloom.
sentences.cn: “我要是那样做了就好了，”菲尔·乔丹说道，又像往常一样消沉起来。

sentences.en: Ellery's return will help to chase away some of the gloom.
sentences.cn: 埃勒里的归来可以驱散一些抑郁的情绪。

sentences.en: He peered into the gathering (= increasing ) gloom.
sentences.cn: 他在渐深的暮色中眺望远方。

sentences.en: Her mood could swing rapidly from gloom to exhilaration.
sentences.cn: 她的情绪可能在转瞬之间从阴郁转向兴奋.

sentences.en: I was peering about me in the gloom.
In the gathering gloom it was difficult to see anything distinctly.
sentences.cn: 在越来越暗的情况下,什么东西都看不清.

sentences.en: My eyes were becoming accustomed to the gloom.
sentences.cn: 我的眼睛渐渐适应了黑暗。

sentences.en: The conference begins this week against a backdrop of unmitigated gloom.
sentences.cn: 会议这个星期在一片愁云惨雾中开始.

sentences.en: The economic gloom of the early 1980s was relieved by fanciful architecture.
sentences.cn: 20世纪80年代初期的经济萧条气氛因各种奇异古怪建筑的出现而有所缓解。

sentences.en: The gloom deepened after a thumping £45m loss at British Rail.
sentences.cn: 英国铁路公司遭受了4,500万英镑的巨额损失后境况更加惨淡。

sentences.en: The gloom deepened as the election results came in.
sentences.cn: 选举结果陆续传来，失败的情绪越来越重。

sentences.en: The news cast a deep gloom over the whole family.
sentences.cn: 那个消息使全家笼罩着一片愁云惨雾.

sentences.en: The pound's weakness compounded the widespread gloom in the City.
sentences.cn: 英镑的疲软加重了笼罩在伦敦金融区上空的惨淡愁云。

sentences.en: The report on our economic situation is full of doom and gloom.
sentences.cn: 这份关于我们经济状况的报告充满了令人绝望和沮丧的调子.

sentences.en: Why are people so full of gloom and doom?
sentences.cn: 为什么人们如此沮丧悲观？

words.tran_cn: 变阴暗；变忧沉；感到沮丧

phrases.tran_cn: 使…变得暗淡；使…蒙上阴影；使罩上悲伤的气氛
